# Common Stochastic Variables
## Bernoulli
A bernoulli stochastic variable $X\sim\Ber{n, p}$ has the sample space $\Omega = \{0, 1\}$ with the probabilities $\Pr{X = 1} = p$ and the opposite, $\Pr{X = 0} = 1 - p$.

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
$$
\begin{cases}p &\textrm{if } x = 1\\ 1 - p &\textrm{if } x = 0\end{cases}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = p
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = p \cdot (1-p)
$$



## Bionomial
A bionomial stochastic variable is a bernoulli stochastic variable repeated $n$ times.

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
The PMF (see @sec-PMF) is given as
$$
\binom{n}{k}\cdot p^k \cdot \left(1-p\right)^{n-k}
$$
where $k$ is the number of $1$'s out of the possible $n$ experiments.

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = n \cdot p
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = n \cdot p \cdot (1-p)
$$

## Poisson
$X \sim \Pd{\lambda}$
$\lambda > 0$

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
The PMF (see @sec-PMF) is given as
$$
p_X(x) = \frac{\lambda^x}{x!}\exp{-\lambda}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = \lambda
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = \lambda
$$

## Gaussian {#sec-Gaussian_Stochastic_Variable}
$X \sim \Nd{\mu, \sigma^2}$. The standard Gaussian distribution is given as $X \sim \Nd{0, 1}$.

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
The PDF (see @sec-PDF) is given as
$$
f_X(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \cdot \pi} \cdot \sigma}\exp{- \frac{1}{2 \cdot \sigma^2}\left(x - \mu\right)^2}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = \mu
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = \sigma^2
$$


## Uniform
$X \sim \Ud{a, b}$

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
$$
f_X(x) = \begin{cases}
    \frac{1}{b - a} & x \in [a, b]\\
    0 & x \notin [a,b]
\end{cases}
$$
$$
F_X(x) = \begin{cases}
    0 & x < a\\
    \frac{x - a}{b - a} & a \leq x \leq b\\
    1 & x > b
\end{cases}
$$


### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = \frac{1}{2}\left(a + b\right)
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = \frac{1}{12}\left(b - a\right)^2
$$

## Exponential
### Distribution {.unnumbered}
$$
f_X(x) = \begin{cases}
    \lambda \cdot \exp{-\lambda \cdot x} & x > 0\\
    0 & x \leq 0
\end{cases}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = \frac{1}{\lambda}
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = \frac{1}{\lambda^2}
$$

## Gamma
### Distribution {.unnumbered}
$X \sim \Gamd{\alpha, \beta}$
$$
f_X(x) = \begin{cases}
    \frac{\beta^\alpha}{\varGamma(\alpha)} x^{\alpha - 1}\exp{-\beta \cdot x} & x > 0\\
    0 & x \leq 0
\end{cases}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = \frac{\alpha}{\beta}
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = \frac{\alpha}{\beta^2}
$$

## Chi-square
$X \sim \Gamd{\frac{k}{2}, \frac{1}{2}}$
$k\in\mathbb{N}$

### Distribution {.unnumbered}
$$
f_X(x) = \begin{cases}
    \frac{x^{\frac{k}{2} - 1}\exp{- \frac{x}{2}}}{2^{\frac{k}{2} \cdot \varGamma\left(\frac{k}{2}\right)}} & x > 0\\
    0 & x \leq 0
\end{cases}
$$

### Expected Value {.unnumbered}
$$
\E{X} = k
$$

### Variance {.unnumbered}
$$
\Var{X} = 2 \cdot k
$$
